listitem.para: SaxonJS is an XSLT 3.0 processor written (mostly) in JavaScript.
It runs both in the browser and on Node.js

chapter.title: Tutorial setup
chapter.para: The tutorial is available from the GitHub repository: . The README describes a number of options, but we’ll try the simplest thing first.

listitem.para: Open up a shell window and navigate to the directory where you cloned the repository.
Run ./gradlew pythonServerStart (on Windows, use .\gradlew everwhere we say ./gradlew!
Open in your favorite (JavaScript enabled) web browser.

chapter.para: Do you see a “Click me” button? Does it work?
